author: Reuters Editorial
title: 11th Circuit revives gender-based pay bias lawsuit
text: By Robert Iafolla A federal appeals court on Wednesday revived a pay bias lawsuit brought by a former manager at an Atlanta-based car retailer who accused the company of paying her significantly less than her male predecessor because of her gender. A unanimous three-judge panel of the 11th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals said a jury could decide if sex played a role in Manheim Remarketing Inc's decision to pay Qunesha Bowen less, despite the nondiscriminatory reasons the company offered to explain the disparity.
